byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and David E. Sanger from Washington. Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London.
byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: International Atomic Energy Agency official endorses samples from Iranian nuclear facility, despite controversial procedure which allowed Iranians to collect them rather than outside inspectors; agency asserts video surveillance of process and subsequent tour of facility showed no violations of its standards.
lead_paragraph: In the absence of outside inspectors, surveillance devices watched at the Parchin military base, the International Atomic Energy Agency said.

headline.main: Atomic Agency Defends How Iran Collected Evidence at Secret Base
headline.print_headline: Atomic Panel Defends How Iran Evidence Was Collected

snippet: In the absence of outside inspectors, surveillance devices watched at the Parchin military base, the International Atomic Energy Agency said.
